name: crick
content:
crick noun [C]
(PAIN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a painful, usually sudden stiffness in a group of muscles in the neck or back: I got a crick in my neck from painting the ceiling.

crick noun [C]
(STREAM)
US a word used in some parts of the United States for a
creek : The water was a crick, just as he had said, channelled by a low bank.
Milton Cogheil/EyeEm/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examples"What's down there?" "Water. What we used to call a crick," his father said, smiling at the word.Go down to the crick and catch a turtle.

to twist the muscles in the neck or back, causing painful stiffness: I cricked my neck while I was painting the ceiling. I think I may have cricked my neck a little bit.
More examplesFewer examplesThe monitor is hung high on a wall, so that you crick your neck looking up at it.He raised his head so quickly he cricked his neck. She cricked her neck so badly that the chiropractor she went to see refused to touch it.
